text: Sample from a 33cl bottle at Leuven Innovation Beer Festival 2017 (5 VI 2017). The looks are splendid: a perfect looking, light pink coloured collar, pretty vivid, topping a great, clean, fluorine red body. The start is appealing for sure. The nose is a spiced infused fruit ale with flavours of raspberries and redcurrants. There is an interesting black pepper dash in there as well. The taste begins with a rhubarb onset, a ginger and black pepper body, some subtle redcurrant features and a medium carbonation. The sourness is sharp and acidic. The mouthfeel is quite dry, making this a lovely quencher - as it was a hot beer festival day. This must portray the krieks oak aged treatment.

On tap at VCBF17, Belgium. 
Nose is cherry soup. 
Body is hazy pinky redhead is small, pink, creamy, mostly diminishing, good lacing. 
Aroma is milky cherry. 
Medium sweet, medium fruity sour. 
Finish is medium lasting sour cherry. 
Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. 
Bit heavy, interesting, nice one.

LIBF2017. Barwa wiśniowa, tylko minimalnie zamglona, z różową, dość wysoką pianą.
Aromat kwaśny, wytrawny, owocowy. Są wiśnie i inne czerwone owoce, w tle akcenty winne.
Smak podobnie owocowy, znów wytrawny, cierpki i kwaśny. Wiśnie i czerwone winogrona dalej porzeczka stanowią kręgosłup tego pysznego piwa
Wysycenie średnie w kierunku do wysokiego, piwo jest bardzo gładkie i miękkie.

F: huge, pink, average retention.
C: dark red, hazy, opaque.
A: red fruits, cherries, raspberries, lemon, light funky, brett.
T: red forest fruits, sour cherries, light lactic, sour raspberries, alcohol is very well hidden, medium body, medium to high carbonation, light wood and vinegar, not bad, really enjoyable beer, 33cl bottle from LIBF 2017 in Leuven.
Dark pink colour. Aroma has light astringency and sweet cherry. Balanced flavour with light sourness and mild cherry taste.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2017 Bottle. Color: Ruby to red, dense pink head. Taste: Medium sweet, cherries, mildly sour / acidic, little hints of yeast and sugar. Starting more to the sweet side, finish is more to the sour and dry side. Fine kriek beer.

Robe rouge opaque, mousse rosée, col moyen, tenue moyenne. Nez sur la cerise puissant, sucré, sorbet. Bouche très fruitée, moins sucrée quau nez. Arôme de fruit légèrement de confiserie, mais sans excès. Belle acidité. Touche boisée, très légère salaison. Carbonatation moyenne. Bière de base comme triple, ce qui donne une kriek/bière fruitée douce naturellement, ronde. 8.5 ABV très bien masqué rafraîchissante grâce à son petit goût acide.
From a bottle at Oud Beersel during Tour de Geuze 2017. Pours a cloudy pale ruby with an off white head. Flavors of cherry. Refreshingly tart.

Bottle pour. Red crimson, some lace. Aroma is cherry, soap, sugar, oak, wood and perfumes. Very fragrant. Dark red color mirrors the sour fruit notes of cherry. Really nice dessert beer. Ill watch this guy play piano while I drink my beer in an underground, hidden Belgian bar in Tokyo.

Bottle. Pours clear red, with a creamy, red head. Aroma is cherries, currants, oak, leather and tannins, as well as notes of chocolate. Medium to full body, with average carbonation. Flavour is tart, with balsamic vinegar, cherries and currants, as well as notes of strawberries, wood, leather and tannins. Lingering notes of wood and berries in the finish.

330ml bottle. Pours cloudy and the colour of cherry pie filling with a one finger pink tinged cap. A complex nose, cherry candy, yeast, mild vinegar, some definite funk, and a bit of the ol barnyard going on. Taste wise, tart acidic notes, light cherry candy, a tiny bit of orange peel, sugary candy notes, and light funk that heads into watery acidic notes with faint cherry, and bready notes with a bit of citrus, and cherry candy in the tart finish.
violacea nocciola cilega ben acida acetica aspra intensa discreto fruttato secca alcool piuttosto nascosto

reddish colour , minimal pinkish head; aroma of sour cherry, balsamic vinegar cinnamon and wood barrel notes, taste of extremely intensive overripe slightly bitterish sour cherry, cinnamon, and woody notes, sour cherry tart and some balsamic vinegar; very good - thank you, kapusil!

0.33l bottle. Slightly hazy bright red body with a thin pink head. Aroma of sour cherry, sugar syrup, lemon zest and cinnamon. Taste of sour cherry, lemon juice, sugar syrup and some vinegar. Seems to be sweet first, but ends up dry and sour. I like it.

Bottle from Brugge and shared with Big G. Pours dark ruby red with a small pink head round the edge of the glass. Nose is rich with a spirit kick finished with red fruits. Taste is lighter than the nose suggests. Fruity with toffee and wheat. It has quite a creamy finish - very nice.

Bottle brought back from Bruges and shared with Pix. Pours a hazy red colour with a pink tinged head. Sour cherry aroma with some balsamic vinegar. The taste is similar. Plenty of balsamic and sour cherry with sherbet and a refreshing tart finish. Very good.

Flaske 330ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø - Langnes. Mørkerød. Kortlivd brusende skum. Lett bringebæraroma. Smaken sprudlende. Altfor mye kullsyre. Smaken kirsebær. Tørr syrlig ettersmak. En del bunnfall igjen på flaska.

Bottle.
Nice red color, hazy, big head. Aroma: berries, red wine, vinegar. Taste: long lasting sour, berries, wood, strong carbo. ABV well hidden.
Mörkröd öl med ett bra rosavitt skum. Doft av körsbär, bärsyrlighet och trä. I smaken tillkommer lätt funkighet och mandel.
Frisse sprankelende zure neus. Smaak zure kriek met een leuke wrangheid en lichte cuberdon toets. Veel koolzuur. Fijne tintelende afdronk.
Pours amber with almost no head. Sweet and sour cherry aroma. Very tart, cherry, swee cherry, medium acidity, lacto bite and sour dry finish. Medium body and carbonation. Refreshing!

[Bottle] Extremely fruity ester aroma along with cherry and some peppery phenolics. Hazy red under a white collar. Sour cherry flavour, with peppery phenolic Belgian yeast character and some lambic, farmhouse character. Light body, high carbonation, crisp start, smooth ending.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2016 Bottle (from koht). Pours red with pinkish head. Aroma is sour, sweet, funky, cherries. Flavor is sour, swe, cherries, sugar, some funk, acidic, cinnamon. Finish is sour and some funk, vanilla. Overall: good.
Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Day 2 on Advent Calendar. Colour is pale rose to red, with pale pink head. Aroma has raspberries and cherry, Taste sweet to light sour. Light body.

Pours a moderately hazy red with a medium lightly pink head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is indeed kriek-like with some fleshy but mostly just tart cherries. Some light funk, too. Taste is lightly tart and not too sweet, offers more of the kriek-ish cherries. Absolutely no signs of the alcohol. Oaky. Body is light, carbonation moderately high. Definitely could use more body even if that means a little more sweetness. Overall a pretty enjoyable tart cherries belgian ale that doesnt feel like a tripel at all.

330ml bottle. Pours clear red colour. Thin white head on top. Raspberries, redcurranrs, some acidity in the aroma. Raspberries at first. Redcurrants, some acidity in the middle. Raspberries and white wine like acidity in the end. Rather dry finish. Light bodied, nicely balanced, medium carbonated sour beer.

Bottle from Berkeley Bowl West. Pours reddish brown with a magnificent pink head and a fragrant cherry aroma. There is a moderately sour cherry flavor over a brown ale base with a lovely oak finish. Reminiscent of the old sour browns that have mostly faded away, though a little more kriek-like. A nice experience.

Bottle at home. Pours a slightly hazy deep red colour with a big pink head. Well carbonated. Aroma of red currants, cherries, oak, brown sugar, forest floor, spices, earth and apple cider vinegar. Sour flavour with lime, sour berries, oak, earth, forest floor and wheat. Has a slick and soft mouth feel, full-bodied and a light bitterness. A fruity and sour ale with sweet undertones. Well balanced.

Bottle from Hop Duvel. Pours light hazy red with a medium pinkish head. Aromas of cherries, marzipan, vanilla, sweet raspberries. Taste has sweet marzipan, tart raspberries, cherries, cherry skin, vanilla.
Pours hazy bright red with an off white head. Aroma of cherries, marzipan, weak stable, vanilla and weak candy. Taste of cherries, marzipan, tart funk, candy and lemon zest.

From bottle. Pours a clearish ruby red with a small pink head. Aroma has cherry, dirty, unripe fruits, raspberry, slight pithy, slight marzipan. Taste is more marzipan, rather sour, dry, tiny sweetness, mostly dry. Somewhat oaky and spicy. High carbonation and a light body for the ABV.
Red, small head, fruity aroma, cherry, fun, fresh, bretty, fruity flavor, lemony, bretty, fun, refreshing, dry, leaves, green tea, medium bodied.

Bottle from Dranken Geers. Bright opaque red to pink with a medium white foam head which dissipates to thin. Nose is tart sweet cherry, marzipan, sour berry fruit, raspberry, slight vanilla, some creaminess, lactobacilus sour. Taste is tart and sour, cherry, with some slight cherry stone bitterness. Nice funk and fruit, bold tartness but slight cherry stone astringency, with marzipan notes.
Aromat mocno wiśniowo beczkowy. W smaku średnia do wysokiej kwaśność, lekko cierpko i gorzko. Spoko kwaśnych wiśni, kwaśnych winogron, dębowej beczki.
Roze rood bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is fris zuur en fruitig met iets van kersen en braam. Best aardig maar niet mij stijl.

Matt tåkete rød med høyt rosa skom som legger seg fort. Lukter sure røde bær, vanilje og noe trevirke. Minner meg om vaniljepudding med rød saus. Smaker surt, syrlig, røde syrlige bær, kirsebær og noe vanilje.

Bottle at home. Hazy ruby with fizzy pink head. Lots of sour cherries, some almonds, berries, dough, light spices, soft red wine vinegar, light herbal. Almost medium sour with nice underlying sweetness for a nice balance, and theres soft bitterness in the finish. Medium bodied with quite some fizzy carbonation. Nice.

Bottled. 30cl sample. The aroma has light-moderate marzipan, cherry, raspberry. Bit hazy, red coloured beer with a thin, pink head. The taste is light sour, bit sweet and has cherries mainly, some marzipan. Above average carbonation. Medium bodied beer. Nice.
Bottle. Dark red color with light pink head. Aroma has cherries, berries, wood. Quite tart and funky. Taste is quite dry and sour with long nice aftertaste. Flavors of cherries, raspberry, apples.
Lyst rødt med lavt skum. Lukter kirsebær, vanilje og en del krydder. Kirsebær og krydder i smaken, God bitterhet, nesten litt besk. Sprudlende, men litt tynn munnfølelse.

Bottle 330ml. [ As De Leite Cuvée Soeurise ].Clear medium to dark red color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white - light pink head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy cherry, wood - cherry stones, tart cherry, light barnyard. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, tart cherry, fruity - berry, almonds, cherries, funky, wood - cherry stones. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20141205]
Bottle thanks to Rick. Pours a hazy copper ruby with medium off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong cherry skin, funk, wood. Thin body, oak, cherry pith, jammy, nice tart finish, very good.

330 ml bottle from Etre Gourmet, bb 02-02-2019.
Deep ruby, hazy body, with a medium, fizzy, a bit lacing, slightly pink head.
Fresh aroma of more sweet than sour cherries, berries, wine, funk, oak.
Taste follows this, with some more vinegar notes.
Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with a fizzy carbonation.
Finishes medium sour, a bit funky, moderate wooden, with cherries, subtle alcohol.

Tasty. I was expecting something more heavy and puckeringly sour and instead got a refreshing and comparatively easy beer, with a great balance between sweet and sour. This is pretty much about the cherries, while theres room for other things, like well integrated funk and wine barrel notes. Lovely stuff.

Bottle pour at The Sovereign during the evening with Brouwerij De Leite event. Poured a very hazy, ruby red color with a pink, small head. Aroma was cherry pie filling, so much cherry skin in this one. Light bitter cherry. So juicy. Flavor was nice cherry juice. Not very tart. Perhaps a touch of wine? Very mild, tart, sweet but acidic finish. Nicely balanced. Solid.

[8587-20160715] 330mL bottle. Soured grainy plywood and mild grains aroma. Slightly hazy, deep red body with a medium-lasting foamy light grey head. Tart and soured mineral cherry flavour has a lingering aftertaste. Medium body is fairly sour. Good. (7/3/7/4/15) 3.6
(c/o B&DC, w/ jercraigs, mds)
Overheard: "Youre foods trying to run away from you."
750 bottle. Pours bright pink and clear. Big cherry and woody nose. Drinks very sour and tart but cannot find the 8.5% here. Delicious.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 sniadanko: Brouwerij De Leite by Cuvée SoeuriseRami Rami is drinking a Cuvée Soeurise by Brouwerij De LeiteIntensywnie wisniowe, kwasnosc srednia, owocowa, w tle sporo drewna, pestek, dzikich nut nieco siano-stajennych, bez goryczki, pestkiwe posmakiOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Aromat: Dzikość, wiśnie, winność, dębowa beczka.
Wygląd: Wiśniowe (hehe) wraz z delikatną pianą.
Smak: Skojarzenia z dojrzałym winem oraz mocnymi, kwaśnymi wiśniami, dalej skóra, końska derka. Wszystko to podane w przyjemnej, lekkiej formie, która sprawia, że piwo jest niezwykle pijalne. Świetny kriek.

Bottle from deanso/kermis shared tickbox at cellar cleanout tasting at deansos. Thanks! Red hazy white head. Sweet and sour cherries, lactic sour. Under medium sweet, medium sour, light saltiness from mineral touch. Medium body, soft carbonation and minerallike texture.

bottler shared.
Thin pink head. Hazy pink pour. Funky aroma. A bit sour. Not my sort of beer
Bottle shared thanks to kermis and deanso. Clear ruby pour with a thin pink head. Notes of cherries, cherry jam, almonds. Medium body, medium carbonation and a sour and lightly sweet finish.

2016-07-15. Lightly hazy red body with a nice foamy pink head that fades. Aroma of cherry, whispers of funk if you look hard. 7+ Flavour has sweet cherry up front, lightly tart and sour. 7+ Average bodied palate, good carbonation. Enjoyable but simple, with not nearly as much sourness and depth as some other krieks, but fairly enjoyable nonetheless. 7/4/7-8/3/15-16 Bottles from the LCBO courtesy of my parents, Mississauga.
33cl bottle at home. Hazy red body with medium pinkish head. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. Quite sour with fruit sweetness. Sour cherries, tart, vinegar. Dry aftertaste. Good.
How : bottle Appearance : red with a small pink head. Aroma : sour cherries, red wine vinegar, citrus peel, "barn smell". Palate : medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle, december 18th 2015. Unclear light red body with apink head. Aroma of sour cherries, brett funk. Taste is dry acidic, with a heavy berry presence, tangerine and leather. Tart finish, light sweetness in aftertaste is taking a bit away from the dry kriek feel but who am I to complain, all in all a very nice beer.

Obfita, drobna, różowa piana skrywa czerwono brunatny, mętny trunek, który w aromacie kusi świeżymi wiśniami i kwaskowo-dzikimi nutami. W tle można też wyczuć wytrawne wino i starą dębową beczkę. Piękny i intensywny zapach to wstęp do fascynującej ferii smaków - kwaśne dojrzałe wiśnie, czerwone wino, migdały, dębina, stara beczka, końska derka, skóra, pikantne przyprawy... Goryczka nieduża, pestkowo taninowa, alkohol ładnie wkomponowany, średnie wysycenie, kwaskowe, lekko cierpkie i odświeżające w odbiorze.
Klasa piwo, jeden z najlepszych Krieków, jakie dane mi było degustować. Najważniejsze jest to, że jest bardzo złożony i wielowymiarowy, a leżakowanie w obecności lactobacillus w beczce po winie nadało mu sporo winno-taninowo-funky posmaków.

DAA; Bottle 33 cl., from Vinmonopolet. Pours large red with a bobble creamy, fading, somewhat lacing, reddish head. Nose is moderate to heavy, cherries, almonds, moderate sour, yeast and light spice. Taste is medium sweet and bitter sour with a lasting, sweet fruit, sour berries and a light warming finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is average.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Lots and lots of cherries indeed, but really unlike a lambic. Still sour, but far more tame and soft. Some tartness, no funk. Cant find the oak aging though. Still a well drinkable beer with a good balance. Nice.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2016 Zeer mooi robijnrood van kleur met fijne roze schuimkraag. Zurig-fris aroma, beetje vineus. Zure aanzet die mooi overvloeit in zoet en fruitig en eindigt in een warme, droge afdronk. Zeer goed in balans en lekker verfrissend. Prima !!
Rood-roze bier met lichtroze schuimkraag. Geur: zuur, pitten van krieken, tannine. Smaak: zuur, krieken, aangename vlezige zurigheid. Afdronk: amandel en droog.

Bottle from Willems. It pours deep ruby with a creamy pink head. Loads of cherries in the aroma along with a oaky kick combined with a hint of almonds. The flavor has a mild sour expression and is loaded with cherries. Some wooden notes. Very tasty and drinkable.

Bottle @ home. Violacea, limpida con riflessi rubino. schiuma rosata grossolana e poco persistente (unico vero "difetto" di una birra davvero strepitosa).Aroma molto intenso e persistente. frutta rossa matura (amarene e lampone). vaniglia, legno, polvere, vino rosso. Gusto abboccato, acido, marcatamente fruttato, di ciliegia, amarena, legno/ vaniglia ed un filo citrico. Corpo pieno, carbonatazione fine e "pungente". Piacevolmente calda, al contrario di molte altre birre alla frutta. Spigolosa. Equilibrata ed armonica.

Zurig kersen kriek aroma. Donker rood iets lichter dan een Wijntje met een mooie roze smeuïge schuimkraag. Heerlijk (azijn) zure kriek die na een jaar staan nog een uitgesprokenere smaak heeft. Mooie balans tussen zuur en kersensmaak.
A nice kriek, not too sour, with clear cherry flavour. Well done, lots of pink foam out there.

A nice sour kriek, with high alcohol levels (8.5ABV).
Colour is red, hazy with minimal pink head.
Medium sourness for a kriek with some hints of wood.
medium body, lively.
Overall is a pleasant beer

Sample at En Öl- och whiskymässa Göteborg 2016. Cloudy red pink beer with very thin white head. Sour raspberries, dry wood, oak, sour apples and tart funky. Dry with low bitterness and medium carbonation. Very nice!

Öl o whiskymässan in Göteborg 2015, Saturday. Hazy reddish beer with a nice pinkish head. Sour fruity aroma, berries, grapes, woody, leather notes, some barnyard. Sour dry berry flavor, barnyard, raspberries, citrus, leather notes. Very sour, very nice.

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning, best before February 2019. Minimally hazy, luscious, pinkish red with a medium large, fluffy, stable, pinkish white head. Sourish-fruity, slightly funky aroma of cherries, raspbberries, red wine, oak and almond. Medium sour, fruity and slightly funky taste of cherries, raspberries, red wine, lots of oak and some almond, followed by a medium long, over medium tart, oaky and slightly vinous finish. Medium body, astringent and effervescent mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Very refreshing, good body and quite drinkable despite is acidity. Good!

Pours deep burgundy brown with a large pink head. Aroma is a burst of cherries with some cinnamon. Taste is cherry sweet, cherry tart, low tart acidity, cinnamon and some almond sweetness. Lingering finish.

Bottle. Neon purple-red, low off white head. Cherry yoghurt aroma. Medium light body, but plenty chewy bits. Sweet fruity entry, light dry notes, a hint nutty, müsli, some esters, banana, skyr with fruit - perfect for breakfast. Satisfying.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2016 Bottle. Deep purple-red color with pink head. Aroma is lacto, cherries, yoghurt, vanilla (wood?), no funk. Taste is sour cherries, fruit esters, cherry stone, full-bodied, slightly boozy. High carbonation. Really what the name suggests: A Triple Kriek. Like a Topfencreme. Let?s age another bottle of this. Really one of the best non-Lambic cherry beers.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy deep red with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, cherries, wood and tart. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish with warming alcohol. 130416

Bottle @ Johns. Pours deep red with an offwhite head. Aroma of sourness, wood, oak, sour tart cherry, light spice, light almond, yougurt. Flavor is light tart, wood, sour cherry, wood, oak, almond. Medium body, lively carbonation, light acidic finish. 130416

Bottle, 8.5%. CLear deep ruby with small pink head. Aroma is malt, cherries, fruit, cherries stone and a little marzipan. Flavour is malt, cherries, almond, little citric, cherry stones, wood, oak, little sour, little sweet, notes of acetone and a little bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is ruby red. Aroma and taste are rich fruits, cherries, malt, marzipan, malt and hops. Sweet and fruity with light sour finish.

On tap at Växjö Ölfestival. Red with pink head. Aroma has cherries, fruit skins, grapes, wood, lacic and slight acetic notes and some bretty funk. Taste is tart and sour, lactic and slight acetic, tart cherries, barrel, oak, berry skins and sour fruits. Really good one.
Flaska från Boxbeer.com. Smak och doft av röda vinbär, körsbär, körsbärsgodis, mjölksyra, körsbärskärnor och svarta vinbär. Fin syra, lagom sötma, fina smaker i god balans, gott!

Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Tom L. Cloudy red with a pinkish head. Great cherries aroma, a bit jammy, sourish, with some oak, mild funk. Tart and slightly sweetish flavor, with lots of cherries, some oak, and a funky note. Medium-bodied. Great, delicious.

An opaque reddish body, with a frothy, decidedly pink head. Aromas of sour cherries and light grass kiss the nose. The mouthfeel is tight and tart. One can feel the tongue and throat constricting minutely in reaction to the sourness. Tastes are cherries, fruits, mint, and much more dry than sweet.
Id rank this up in the upper echelon of sour beers. Simply delicious.

Flaska från Boxbeer.com. Gyllenröd med mörkrosa skum. Syrlig och söt med doft av syrligt körsbärsgodis och Maoms körbärskola. Tydligt syra men också godissötman och smaken i bra balans dessutom syrliga svarta och röda vinbär. Riktigt gott.
Bottle. Pours reddish with a White head. Aroma of cherries, tart, barnyard, fruity jam. Taste is tart, barrn, sour cherries, Woody. Quite well balanced nice.

Batch 5. Aroma is cherries, skins, red wine, barrel, like a wonderful candy cherry, it smells phenomenal. Appearance is ruby red, light pink head, poured almost syrupy. Taste is tart cherry, wine barrel, skins, funk, cherry juice, amazing. Mouthfeel is medium body, crisp carbonation, a dessert wine aftertaste. Overall, my god is this tasty.
Bottle. Dark red color. Nice aroma of sour cherry and oak. Taste of tart, sour cherry, tannine, oak, lacto and some red wine. Very nice, like a flemmish old brown/red.
Flaska bishops Örebro. Mörkrosa/röd kulör med ljusrosa skum. Frisk och syrlig doft av körsbär, äpplekart och stall. Samma i smak. Fin munkänsla.

A reddish burgundy ale with a lacing thick collapsing pinkish white head. In aroma, tart cherry with loads of mineral notes, Brett, fruity esters and acidity, very nice. In mouth, a nice tart cherry with light Brett, light mineral notes, very good acquisition from LCBO.

(Bottl, 0.33 l, at tiongs tasting, thanks rosenbergh, 20160317) The beer poured red. Its head was small and reddish. Aroma had cherries, cherry stones and malts. Palate was medium bodied, warming and rather dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were cherries, wood, malts, sweetness and sourness. Aftertaste was woody and sour. A good beer with lots of cherriess and still balanced.

Dark red with airy pink head. Acetic, vinous aroma, berries, cherries and hints of wood. Sour, acetic flavour. Sour cherries and nice barrel notes, marzipan and soft spice. Finish is dry with touches of paint thinner or acetone... but not in a bad way.

0,33l bottle at home shared with a friend. BB 13.Mei.2016. (i guess?). copper / redish color, small off-white head. smells sour, oak, cherries, marzipan, nutty, green apples, some funk, very nice wood notes. very very nice smell. full body, medium bubbly carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes sour, cherry juice, some nuts, marzipan, wood, oak notes, some funk, bit glueish. finishes medium sour with very nice cherry notes, green apples and notes of wood.very very nice one.

Bottle at home. Dark red colour, slightly hazy, pink foamy head with nice retention. Sour cherry nose but funky too. Taste is big on tard cherry, funky, medium sweet, nice tannins from the oak aging, cinnamon, vinous character reminiscent of Rodenbach. Medium body (a bit bigger would?ve made this an absolute banger), low carbonation. Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2016 Reddish pink color, light pink head. Aroma of cherry and raspberry. Taste is sour berries, light tannins. Decent.8-3-8-3-13. 2/26/2016.
Re-rate 9/12/2016: Bottle sample at The Sovereign.  More pronounced cherry aroma with tannins.  Flavor has cherry and sourdough brownie dough.  Holy cow.

Un liquide pourpre, profond, rubis et même rouge vin, parfaitement translucide et présentant une impressionnante mousse rose bonbon lors du service. Cest en quelque sorte limage que je me fais dun jus de cerises noires fraîchement pressées. Nez qui révèle peu de choses. Arômes de blé et dune cerise pas griotte du tout, mais bien mûre et plus ronde que sûre. Le fruit demeure timide mais tend à se révéler petit à petit au fur et à mesure que le liquide se détend dans mon verre. Ça demeure toujours un peu poussiéreux. En bouche je nai pas limpression de boire une kriek. Un petit fruit bien naturel, je veux bien. Heureux de ne pas être confronté à une kriek sucrée et sirupeuse. Celle-ci est toute en fraîcheur et délicatement fruitée. Ma première impression était celle de la déception mais en lui laissant le temps de sexprimer, la bière révèle une douceur et une délicatesse qui sont en fait de belles qualités. Lalcool est imperceptible, le fruit léger, le palais agréable et pétillant. Je crois quen terrasse, cette bière pourrait faire des malheurs!

Draft @ Taproom, Malmö. Pours a slightly hazy red color with a small pinkish white head. Has a fruity sour tart cherry aroma. Fruity sour tart acidic cherry flavor. Has a fruity sour tart acidic cherry finish.

330ml bottle at home in Richmond as Cuvée Surise, 8.5%, BB 2016. Really dark reddy brown, big foamy dense pink head. Aroma is vinegar, meaty, dark cherry, plasticine, rubber, red wine and some acetone. Lots going on. Body is light, a little foamy, soft carbonation. Taste is tart and sour with some lemon, cherry and varnish. A slow sipper. Just a bit harsh in places.
On bottle from Vinonpolet Norway. Deep red color, good foam. Medium/high aroma intensty; cherries dominates, some barrel influence. Medium body & medium/high complexity. Good sourness. Very enjoyable

0.33 l bottle from Firma Bier. Dark red color with pink quickly dissipating head. Aromas of sour cherry, lingonberry and wet wood. Fat sour cherry taste with grapefruit, lingonberries and oak. Some aged meat broth like notes and hints of acetic acid. Fairly dry palate, yet full body.  Drinkabilty is low, still a decent sipper.

330ml bottle thanks to Secret Santa 
Pours hazy deep red with a medium sized pink head, good lacing. Aroma of cherries, sawdust, woody and grassy. Flavors are cherries, dusty, grapes with a tart finish 
I liked this

330ml bottle (tasting @tiongs, thanks). Murky brown color. No head. Sour, woody, acidic, berries and cherry in aroma. Sour, cherry, sweet, bit of acidic and woody in taste. Sour cherries in aftertaste. Crisp mouthfeel. Quite drinkable.

330ml bottle - thanks rosenbergh and the posse at tiongs
Sharp wood-gluey estery aroma (OK, theyre not esters, or glue, but *I* know what I mean by that). Some nice cherry juice too, cheerry stones included. No sign of 8%. Sour body is bloody lovely, a real tart bite. Cherry stones increase later. Good balance of woody ageing sourness and cherry juice sharpness with the sweetness of the base beer and the fruit. Enjoyed.

09.01.2016, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is sour-ish dry fruity, mild vinegar, red berries, grass, oak, weeds, berry skin, cherries, hints of thinner. Taste is sour-ish dry, berry skin, grass, oak, mild vinegar, red berries, sorrel, raw rhubarb, hay, fruit stones, sour apples. Medium bitterness, sour-ish dry mouthfeel. Nice.

330 ml bottle. From JefVerstraete (ELS). Thanks Jef!
Hazy ruby red color with no head. 
Cork, dryness, tartness, red berries and mild acidity in the aroma. 
The flavor is tartness, dryness, red berries, woody dryness and mild cherries. 
Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle

Pours red with a small white head. Aroma of sourish cherries, some tartness, hints of yeast, earthy notes and berries. Taste is sour, oaky and tart with some cherries, yeast, berries and mild earthiness. Finish is sweetish, earthy and mildly sour with hints of tart cherries. Pretty good.
Bottle 0.33l at tiongs, Espoo. Thanks Rosenberg! Colour is deep dark red with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Berries, raspberries, cherries, sourness and some malts. Pretty good.

Many, many thanks for this lovely beer to JefVerstraete. Small pink foam but beer like perfect. Deep red colour witch a lot of heffe and cherries. Taste like fine dry red wine, acid, fruit aroma ofcourse from red friut and taste. This fruit beer almost like good oude kriek. Wood aroma i nose. Finish is long dry and couldt stop. This beer is big pleasure to me specialy to serve to some good matured chees. Enjoy

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Bière Fruité qui laisse apparaître une légère mousse onctueuse sous une couleur rougeâtre et avec une très belle effervescence.

Arôme de cerise en premier plan, avec une petite senteur de vanille.
En bouche, un soyeux mélange de cerise, vanille, je dirais même quelle pétille légèrement en bouche et elle est un temps soi peu épicé
Deep ruby red color, pink head. Cherry nose, almonds, cherry pits, floral notes. Cherry taste, moderate sweetness, sour notes, almonds, well balanced, hint of yogurt. Medium body, soft carbonation.
Trübes dunkelrot mit wenig Schaum. Reichlich fruchtig, Kirschen, sauer, etwas Eichenholz. spritzig.

Bottle 330ml. Thx Czar.
Pours red/pink with medium pink head. Some lacing. Aroma is of cherries, sugar, wood, blackberries, slight caramel. Taste is of cherries, blackberries, acidity, slight alcohol, slight candi sugar. Palate: Mediuim body. High carbonation (surprisingly high). Overall: Quite good.

This one slipped my notice and had to go hunting in Mississauga to find a couple. And Im glad I did. Pours a murky pomegranate pink with some foamy pink head. Berries, sugar and funk in the nose. Nice dry sour bite right off the top, with lots of cherries and some cereal malt taste. Damn nice.

pours bright red-pink with a reviving bubbly pinkish cap, leaving some lacing. bright wild cherries, woodsy jam, wild strawberries, light acidity - bit of funk; some fruit astringency, floral dill, thyme, leather, peppery wheat. bright carbonation, light to medium body - oily; relatively dry fruity-woodsy finish. like a fruit american sour should taste like. nice stuff!

(33 cl. 17FEBR2017). Une robe bourgogne et un anneau de mousse rose. Des traces collées sur la paroi de mon verre. Au nez, les cerises surettes (Prunus cerasus) et les cerises sauvages (Prunus avium) se choquent à des parfums de basse-cour, de cuir et dherbes. Sur les papilles, le liquide transpire les cerises, le vinaigre, le citron et les Brettanomyces en fleurs. En bouche, le corps est huileux et pétillant. En finale, tout est bien sec, suret, boisé, spontané. Si facile à boire avec un alcool complètement caché.

Bottle. Pours a deep copper-hued pink-ish purple body with a large creamy pink-hued white head. Nose is cherries, vanilla, cherry pits, almonds, cinnamon and hints of wood, alcohol and red berries. Taste is cherries, vanilla, sour berry notes, barnyard funk, cherry pits and hints of almonds, hay and red berries. Medium body, high carbonation. Very nice cherry beer (Isnt it a sour? Really?) with loads of fruit complexity. Not my favorite style of beer, but this one is still mighty tasty.

Pours light ruby limited head or lacing. Nose is fruit juice and tart. Flavours of cherries, fruit punch, some cereal, berries. Taste light/med sweet light/med tart. Medium sticky body with lively carbonation.

Glowing red, pink head. Sour cherry, bit candy strawberry, tobacco, tea. Interesting stuff. Not very malty, but still rich enough. Taste is quite string sour, nice rounded palate, with sharp stingy sourness in the end, getting to the throat. Tat harsh but much more developed than I expected. Good beer, classy stuff with a punch. (33cl bottle from ABS Drinks)

330ml bottle from LCBO. Cloudy intense pink body, big soapy pink head with average retention, no lacing. Aroma of tart cherries, grass, hay, leather, some woodsy notes and barn. Taste: moderate sourness, green grapes, sour cherries, old hops, spices. Lovely.
Bottle @ Craigs. Pours red thin slightly pink head. Great nose, raspberry, sour raspberry with a hint of sweetness. Big fruit taste also some woody notes at the end, funk sourness, so nice. Wow

Big foamy pink head with great retention and soapy lacing. The brew is cloudy, cherry red coloured with a slight amber hue. Citric nose with some soft cherries and other fruity notes. The taste has some sourness, but not as strong as a standard lambic. Mild cherries with some tartiness from the yeast. Hints of oranges and other citruses. Not feeling the oak-aged part. A stronger lambic that is quite refreshing and lightly fruity. I was expecting a little more punch though. Nicely brewed overall.

[Bottle (330ml)] Pours a deep dark amber-red with a huge lasting frothy light-pink head. Some lacing. Nice aroma of tart cherries along with wood, spices, caramel malt and hints of funk and vinegar. Flavour follows and everything is just a bit more subtle then the aroma. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium bodied. Really good stuff.

Murky bright red. Ringed white head. Nose is big earnest sweet cherry. Initial taste is rigid tart, earthy sweetness and smooth bitterness. Carbonation is sleek enough and mouthfeel is raking from the tart. Rustic finish, lingers gritty sweetness and overbearing tart linger. Yussss. Bottle, Hop Duvel.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear red.with a thin white head. Aromas of fruit and funk. Taste is tart, sour, cherry, light oak. Sour finish.
Bottle at craigs. Pours deep ruby, nose is horseblanket, raspberry, taste is quite tart, sour, fruity raspberry.

Bottle: Poured a deep bright red color ale with a huge pink foamy head with good retention and light lacing. Aroma of fresh cherry notes is quite powerful. Taste is also totally dominated by fresh cherry notes with light sugary notes and light tart notes are also noticeable. Body is full with limited filtration and good carbonation. I really enjoy this fruit beer which is very refreshing and doesnt end up tasting like fruit syrup.
Sour cherry and decent amount of raspberry. Pours pink with decent head. Tangy finish. Some citrus. Bottle from lickbow.

Pour is a beautiful deep reddish pink with a pale pink cap that sticks around but leaves no lace. Sour cherries, cranberry, lemon, oak, moderate must/funk, light vinegar. This stuff smells delicious. Weirdly I actually found it a touch too sweet up front. The finish is nice and tart, and the club soda carbonation makes this stuff stupid drinkable. Alcohol is pretty much nonexistent. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2015/10/18 - Pours a hazy dark pink (cream soda) colour with a light pink, foamy white head that slowly reduces, leaving no lacing. Aroma is tart cherries, woody notes, funk and mild herbal tones. Taste is lemon rind, sour cherries, oak, vinegar and a touch of funk. Mouthfeel is light to medium with sharp carbonation and a dry, acidic, puckering finish. Light, tart and refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(On tap @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Oct 8 2015) Pours pink/red and slightly opaque with a few whitish bubbles on top. Aroma is acidic, lacto and light acetic, with lots of sour cherry flesh, some wet earth/sulfurous funk notes and oak, light hints of bready malt. On the palate, lactic lemon and sour cherry dominate making it quite tart, with an intense acidic sour bite even for a kriek. Hints of sweetness from the fruit and a little oak show up mid-palate. Funk is restrained compared to the nose. The finish has a real fruit-lacto pucker to it, with acetic hints. Fairly light but not watery, with light carbonation. A pretty decent cherry beer, really on the acidic side but reasonably drinkable still. Solid.

Bottled at Pressklubben, Stockholm. Clear burgundy colour, mid sized head. Tart cherry stone aroma. Dry with mild acidity and medium body, rounded mouthfeel. Acetic cherries, fruit. Low bitterness. Quite intense. Good!
Bottle from bishop arms Helsingborg. Pours a red colour beer with a small head. Fruity, yeasty and bretty. Also a lot of cherries and rasberries. Fruity dry bretty finish. A great birthday beer

Pours a big foamy bubbly pink head that dissipates fairly quickly and has a cloudy reddish/pink appearance. Weak lacing. Aromas are dark fruits (raspberries, cherries) sweet malts and yeast. Flavours are a bit more on the sour and tart side, cherries are noticeable, and actually quite fruity. Has a little bit of a tarty mouthfeel.

Bottle from the LCBO. Deep red-rose body with pink head. Aroma of sour cherry, sour oak, of bit of herbal funkiness, and a tart lemony tang. Flavour follows with similar notes, leading into a particularly acidic & puckeringly sour finish that I could see being off-putting to some, but not for me - if my stomach could take it, Id happily drink this all night.

33cl bottle. Deep dark red pour with light pink head, little to lacing. Aromas of bread, cherry and nuts. Taste has little to no bitterness, really sour and some fruity sweetness. Medium carbonation, fresh palate. Aftertaste is bubbly and sour. A bit too sour even for my taste but interesting and well-made beer.

Bottle to goblet
Lemon, raspberry, flowers, red grapes. Pinkish red with a thin, light tan head. Taste is funk, light sweet lemon, a touch of caramel and apple.

Pour on tap at Crunchys, hazy reddish pour with pinkish head, aroma brought notes of pithy cherry, cherry jam, hints of oak, funky notes, touch of vanilla, slight earthy notes with a touch of dusty basement. Taste was a mix of funk, cherry, vanilla, hints of berry, slight earthy notes with a touch of oak, finishing fairly tart, slightly oaky. Very nice.
(bottle) loudy beet red colour with a tall pink head; aroma of of sourness, cherry; light sour flavour with a short, light sour finish
Big pink head fades quickly than disappears. Deep murky red, looks like cherry jam. Sour, light funk, big cherry, light astringency, high carbonation, light oak, dry finish.

330ml bottle. Deep red with a foamy pink head. Flavors are cherry, lemon and oak with acetic, medicinal and herbal notes. Theres a bit of a clash between the herbal bitterness and the sour cherries. Medium body, good carbonation, smooth texture.
Bottle - Deep, dark cherry notes with a touch of wood. Dark maroon purple with a light pink head. Nice cherry notes, touch of wood and a light tartness. Nice, but not as complex as I had hoped.

330 ml bottle from LCBO, served cold in a tulip glass. 
App.: Vibrant, murky pink with a pinkish head.
 
Aroma: Sour cherries, medicinal/cough syrup cherries, moderate Lambic-like funkiness, a sort of grainy malt presence, yeast/wet bread dough, faint wood/vanilla notes (power of suggestion...?), like alcoholic sting.
 
Palate: Medium body, very full, prickly carbonation, a bit creamy.
 
Flav.: Lots of cherries but also a strong malt/wheat presence, rounded flavour, much lighter wild character, yeast/bread dough again, quite different from the nose (interesting), light citrus, some alcohol; dry with reasonable tartness and a bit of bitterness (astringency?) with a quite malty and subdued cherry finish.

Certainly an interesting beer. Doesnt quite drink like an 8.5% bruiser...

Bottle from Tanakaya. Pours a deep ruby with some lighter highlights. Aromas of cherry and wood with some funky and cobweb-in-basement-on-a-wooden-post-in-the-corner musty character as well. The tartness from the cherries really jumps out along with a nice light horse blanket funk. A bit of young berry as well and loads of wood. Bone dry on the palate with good crisp carbonation. Wonderful.

It pours hazy violet with ruby highlights; the head is pink and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: cherries, lemon juice, funk, and wood. The taste is medium sour that finishes lightly bitter; there are notes of all the aforementioned aroma notes. The palate is medium light bodied with light carbonation and a medium finish. Overall, not much depth

330 ml bottle from the Lcbo. 
Deep red pour, with a small lightly pink head. Aroma is very tart, touches of barnyard, and a deep cherry tartness. The body and carb is good, and balanced. The finish is very tart, with hints of lambic sourness. Loads of great sour fruit, cherries and random berries. The oak ageing isnt very apparent, does seem to add to the beer, but it doesnt detract either. A great summer sour ale.

330ml lcbo bottle. Pours an opaque garnet/ruby with a one and a one and a half finger, light pink head that thins but never fades. Aroma has tart, acidic notes of raspberries, hints of oaky wood, and hints of farmhouse funk. Taste is a medium tart that starts with raspberries, then notes of oak, then a touch of cream soda sweetness, then a drawn out, fruity tart ending. Medium body with a high carbonation. Clean in the mouth with an effervescent carbonation and a dry finish. Overall a really nice medium tart beer. Lots of raspberries with well blended notes of oak.

Surprise find at LCBO brings home this fine late summer Friday afternoon beer. Pours pomegranate red with a sturdy cap of cream soda coloured foam that lasts. Full marks for appearance. Nose is funky vinegar. This is a tart slow sipper, not so much vinegar as just a sturdy lip puckering sourness, with an authentic cherry base. Mrs Tiki steals a 1/3 of my bottle & exclaims "its like the cherries have wet the bed" while im not sure what that means it kind of hits the mark. Recommended.

Light bodied (would like a heavier palate) with a moderately tangy acidty, overall more dry than lemony. The moderate cherry is good and harmonizes or even gets slightly lost in the sour-dry and lightly herbal tastes.

330 mL bottle. Hazy purple with a thick film of pink head. Sour cherries and a hint of cider vinegar in the nose. The flavour isnt as big, sour, oaky, or really even as cherry-flavoured as youd expect. The cherries certainly seem to be real, though, not syrup or extract. This beer is very drinkable for the abv.

LCBO bottle. Pours cloudy bright red with pink head. Nose is sour cherry and vinegar., white wine, some funk and some herbal hops and leather, earthy notes. Tastes like a triple mixed with berries. Tart cherry, some bitterness on the back end fades quick to a mild, sour finish. Really easy drinking for 8.5%, and still complex, but subtle. This is beer for thought.

330 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a maroon colour with large, lasting pink head. Aroma is tart cherry, oak, leather and a bit of vinegar. Flavour is big on cherry and also has an assertive vinegar note, as well as more subtle oak and leather character. Carbonation on the livelier side. Interesting one.

330ml bottle from LCBO @ Summerhill in Toronto. 8.5% Alc./Vol. Pours a cloudy pinkish red colour with two finger of pink head. Aroma of sour cherries and some raspberries. Taste is sour in the beginning and matches the aroma with notes of rhubarb, and cranberries. Finishes a bit dry and hoppy which reminds you that you're not drinking a carbonated fruit juice.

Poured from a bottle. 
Aroma is fairly cherry forward with some sour and sweet, candy cherry notes. Some light oak notes with light acidity and citrus notes. A light barnyard mustiness. Faintly medicinal.
Pours a hazy, deep purplish-red with a light brown hue and a moderately small, somewhat thin, slightly pink head that recedes fairly quickly to the edges where it lingers. Light lacing and medium small legs. 
Flavor is moderately acidic upfront with some light citrus and tropical fruit notes. Moderate sour cherry notes with some lighter candy cherry character mid palate. Medium light bitterness with some light oak notes. A hint of alcohol. A hint of mustiness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a pretty interesting sour cherry beer. Good cherry character with some light oak notes. Acidity is well balanced. Some sweetness.
Bottle, BBE 13/05/16. Pours quite red with a small, white head. Aroma is cherry, sour, some caramel. Taste begins sour, plenty of cherry, cherry candy, some oak, light lavender. Very nice.

330ml bottle [second of a De Leite series kindly delivered by bartlebier - Im very thankful!]. Clear crimson colour with small to average, frothy to macropore, diminishing, pinkish head. Spicy, tart-ish aroma, morello cherry notes on oak and leather. Taste is dry, moderately sour, minimally tannic, notes of sour cherry, hints of wood, some vinegar spiciness. Compact, low-key, unresisting.

330ml bottle. Pours a nice looking clear red shade. Pink-tinged head. Aroma is like many good Belgian krieks. Taste is nicely tart, on the cusp of acidity but not fully there. Balanced and drinkable. Nice and refreshing fruit beer.
On tap at Gambrinus Bruges . One of my favoritestuff so far on this trip. Sour! Vinegar with a touch of kriek sweetness. Fabulous beer.
This is fantastic. Pours a deep blood red. Pink head. Aromas are sour, strawberry jam, cherry jam, fruity. Flavours are sour cherries and oak, strawberries. Nice finish. Phenomenal.

bottle. lush dark potent cherry fruit. soft leather. light vinous dry oak. red semi sweet strawberries, raspberry, cherry wine. soft musty dusty cellar. well balanced all around with a pleasantly dry mouthfeel complimented by semi sweet berry fruit. fun wine, fruit juice, beer combo. not much in the way of tripel character, which is just fine. more of an impy fruit forward sour cherry brew. tame.

33cl bottle. Poured deep red color, thin pink head. Slight tart aroma cherries and some raspberry sweetness, wood. Inviting. Flavor has tartness, cherries, hint of marzipan. Tart, dry finish. Lovely kriek.
Bottle from JefVerstraete, thanks a bunch! Hazy, dirty reddish pour with a tiny head. Very fruit forwarded, cherries and cranberries. Light oak and leather with a pleasant tartness. Tasty stuff!

From draft at ZBF 15, poured a deep dark red colour with a thick Pink head. Lot of dark sweet cherries, slight notes of vinegar, light tart, acid, malts, spicy alcohol notice, oak, thick mouthfeel. Bit to hot for the style for me
From tap. Pours hazy dark amber with a small white head. Aroma is fruityand citric, dry. Dry and citric. Fruity and tart. Citric and dry finish. Dry and fruity citric finish.
Corked bottle from Countbeer, thanks! Ruby red color, hazy. Confit cherry in the aroma. Soft brett. Cherry jam in the sour flavor. Very subtle oak. Lemon. Nice, well made beer.
Very nice kriek. Soureness of the kriek nicely in balance with a mild sweetness. The oak aging is definitely present in the flavour, but in a smooth way. Very nice.

Pours a hazy purple body with a medium head. Aroma of sour cherries. Taste full of cherries with well balanced sourness and excellent carboration.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, thanks SirLimpsalot. 

A bit hazy dark red with a small pink head. Sweet with cherries, berries, light oak and some minerals. Very easy to drink and with a low bitterness. Almost like a lemonade.

@ Eddan 15-2-14: Ganska trevlig men lite diskret doft. Smaken är trevlig syrlig med tydlig körsbär och en tydlig eftersmak av ekfat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!

0.33L bottle from Belgian e-shop

Pours hazy dark red color with amber to red hue. Medium head, off white light pink, dissipates quickly, lacing. Aroma is tart(lactic), unripe fruits, berries,some good funky goodness, some wood(vanilla, cinnamon notes). I expect some good tartness and some salinity, considering the nose. Flavor is very similar, tartness is strong(with acetic acid notes) and beautiful, very dry, some oxidized overtones, wood. Soft carbonation, medium bodied.
Amazing beer, the acidity is quite dominant but not too overpowering.
Zeer zuur en complex bier. Prachtig pallet. Een kriek die er staat. Een favoriet op een warme zomerse avond.

330 ml bottle. Pours cloudy as ruby red as can be, with a tiny off-white head. Cassis nose with some almond and cherries and subtle red forest fruit jam notes. Sweet sour body, quite a round body, nice fruity aftertaste. Taste is clearly cherry (not really the kriek variant). Very nice beer.

Bottle (75cl): Shared, half of the bottle was served at room temperature in my Duvel glass:
Medium sized light pink head. Beautiful hazy dark pink red beer.
Aromas of red fruit, wild yeast, wood, flowers, cinnamon, vanilla and some yoghurt and tart fruits.
Flavours of red fruit, tart, wood, yoghurt, wild yeast, acidic, beautiful beer!
Aftertaste is tart, red fruit, yeast, some wood and light acidic.
Low carbo, drytart mouthfeel, close to full bodied. Damn tasty!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Ruby colour, light pink head. Aroma of cherrie, vinegar, white wine, wet wood, barnyard, citrus. Taste is medium sour, slightly sweet. Light body, slick texture, average carbonation. Very nice.

Backlog rating. 33cl bottle shared at Chrisos May tasting, London. It pours a rich red/ruby color with a medium pink-ish head. Aroma is medium sweet and lightly acidic, with notes of tart charries, wild berries and raspberry jam. Taste is medium sweet and medium acidic, with more cherries, jam, light funk and white wine, light lemon juice in the tart finish. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very tasty and not overly-sweet, exceeded expectations
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Couleur rouge, belle effervescence. Arômes de cerises et boisés. Moyen.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl à Molenhof Restaurant & Bar Oud Postje, couleur rouge/rosée, peu de mousse très vite déliquescente, grosse effervescence, une bière avec une grosse acidité en début de bouche accompagné de cerise aigre. Cette acidité est accompagnée dune attaque sur le bois de chêne en fin de bouche.
Bottle at chrisO... Copper red.. Thin tan lacing... Soft berries fruit.. Tart raspberry.. Soft funk nose... Sharp tart fruits.. Soft funky.. Tart fruits... Big berries.. Juicy fruits nice

Trübe dunkelrötliche Farbe, wenig pinker Schaum. Geruch intensiv fruchig nach Kirschen, reife Früchte, leicht holzig, minimal säuerlich. Geschmack sehr fruchtig, säuerich, holzig, Kirschen, sehr rund, gelungen!

Bottle (330 ml). Hazy red with a medium bubbly pinkish head and little lacing. Aroma is of sweet cherries, oak, vanilla, leafy notes, medicinal and alcohol notes. Taste is of sweet cherries and its moderately sour with cherries notes, oak, vanilla, quite leafy presence, a tad medicinal and alcohol. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Fruity finish. Lingering sweetness. A tad warming too. Decent Sour Ale with cherries. Not super complex. A tad too much alcohol.
Bottle shared with Tom at hotel tasting. Hazy deep red pour with thin white head. Aroma is really leafy, medicinal, some aspirin. Taste is fruity, boozy extremely leafy. Palate is heavy. Meh.
2014.10 - De Leite op bezoek bij de Gentse Biervereniging - roodpaars, rozig schuim - neus : zoets en krieken - mond : perfecte mix van zurig en zoet - toppertje !!!
Si ripropone vinoso inizialmente acido confine acetica Color rubino schiuma scarsa color rosa. Aroma vinoso con note acide e frutta. Gusto che si

33 cl bottle. Deep ruby red with a minimal head. Floral and fruity in the nose; an acidic touch, too. This latter also conjures up red cabbage and beetroot - or is this just because of the colour? Smooth, softly acidic with aromas of apples, cherries, almonds and a gentle yet enriching touch of hops and walnuts in the aftertaste. Out of curiosity, I tried some Gorgonzola with this one, but it didnt turn out to be the best combination.
Huge sour cherry nose on top of oak and slight acidic. Nice deep beet red in color with light magnta foam. Light crisp and dry. Sparkling with horse blanket and woody tannin finish

Big thanks to Matteo. Bottle shared at Chrissos May 2014 tasting 25/05/2014. Pink / red clouded coloured pour with a lasting pink frothy head. Aroma is nice fresh cerry, musty and funk and light acid. Flavour is dark cherry, sweet and tart, musty and horsey funk.
Amber color with white head. Cherry and malt caramel aroma, light sweet and dry with some sourness and cherry flavour.

Bottle at the chriso May 2014 tasting - London. Thanks to Matteo! Pours clear, red-pink with a foamy head. The nose has bright cherry and jammy berries. Light to medium sweet with mellow tartness, slight funk, more vibrant cherry character. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Crisp on the finish with moderate sweetness, juicy cherry, light apple, good and fresh tart kick. Very nice. Drinks well for the strength. Lovely.

33cl bottle, Geers. Cherry Ox blood with a mauve plum shine. Nose of plum pits, burnt oak, mulled wine. Taste is deep cherry marred by bitter pit, made more aggressive by a distinct balsamic, harsh lactobacillus note and cloved mulled wine spice. Considerably less subtle beer than many other De Leite brews, even while attempting something brash like a triple kriek. Will revisit aged.

Courtesy of Jaghana.
Couleur cerise rouge trouble, petite mousse blanche. Super nez cerise, fruité, fut de vin, aigre, vineuse comme oud bruin . Gout fruité cerise griotte aigres, fut de vin, superbe aigreur et bon sucre. Bonne aigreur puis tanin de vin en fin de bouche. On sent a peine les 8.5 c°. Magnifique!

Bottle 33cl, kindly given by Bartlebier thanks. A cloudy red bier with low head. Nose is intence on sour cherry notes, dry, tart, lactic, tannic, light diacetyl, lot of red fruits, light plum, not as dry as a lambic, slightly vinous. Finish has burnt cherry notes, still acid, very nice.

25th May 2014Tasting at the ever gracious ChrisOs. Hazy pinkish red beer, good size pink head. Palate is airy with very fine carbonation. Light cherry and oaky sweetness. Balanced by mild sourness and lemon. Light airy finish. Very pleasant.
Bottle @ Chriso May 14 tasting. Has a rosy raspberry appearance, big super sour kriek taste, sharp, tart raspberry, sweet sugar, dry finish. Massive.
Chriso May 2014 tasting. Cloudy red pink. Fruity on the aroma. Raspberry strawberry flavour. Some sourness. Tasty fruity. Dry finish. Lovely

Bottle thanks to Matteo. It pours deep pink with a small white head. The nose is fresh, fruit, tart cherry, raspberry, sherbet and light candy. The taste is crisp, raspberry seed, cherry, Granny Smith apple, sherbet, candy, wood, light vanilla, earth, lemon peel and dry finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Crisp, tart and fruity. Rather nice.

@ The Capital, Leuven. Dark red colour, light pink foam that disappears quickly. Very fruity aroma of sour cherries. Also some notes of balsamic vinegar. Dry finish. Easy drinkable and very complex fruit beer.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Clear reddish color, small pinkish head. Aroma has fruits, slightly sweetness, a touch of wood, lightly cherries. Taste fruits, cherries, again a touch of wood. I must admit, I was quite skeptical but its pretty nice indeed. Good fruitbeer.
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2014 Bottle @benzai. Pink/red color with a small white head. Smells sour, sweet, red fruit, raspberry. Tastes sweet, red fruit, nice. I was expecting more sourness.

Bottle @ benzai. Purple colour with a small pinkish head. Smells dusty, sour, fruity, cherry, red fruits, slightly mint and fresh. Tastes cherry, some mint, dusty, brett. Nice! Its a bit thin though. Soft but fizzy carbo.

Bottle @ Willems Grobbendonk, Belgium. Pours hazy red With a pink head. Nose is fresh cherries, mild funk and fruit forest. Lovely. Fruity flavor With a touch of marzipan, grain and oak With the cherries shining once again. Quite good.
Shared with Wim at his home. Hazy pink colored beer with small white head and medium carbonation. Herby wooden aroma. Finish is cherry fruitey sour with some wooden hints ending dry. Nice one!

Basta un sorriso ed è colpo di fulmine. E non un fulmine da poco: infiniti megatoni di ciliege che si impossessano interamente del gusto, sublimate da unacidità vorticosa e una leggera ed elisiaca sfumatura dolce. Alcol impercettibile, non si può smettere di berla. Merita indubbiamente un posto donore nellolimpo (o valhalla) delle birre.

pink head that disappears quickly. cherry red colour. aroma of cherries, funk, wood and sour. taste like aroma with a slight wry aftertaste. medium body and carbonation, dry mouthfeel. abv well hidden, really good stuff!  bottle 33 cl / bbf apr-2015
Hazy pink. Big oak, sour cherry. The mouth is mildly tart with tons of cherries. Full body. Alcohol is well hidden, cherries are very intense. Excellent balance. Wonderful cherry beer.

33 cL bottle at home. Pours clear red with a medium to large pink head. Aroma is sour cherries, wood, tart, vinegar and some sweetness. Taste has some cherries, red fruits, wood and a medium sourness. Medium body and carbo.

Bottle at Capital. Dark red colour, with small thin pink bubbly head. Aroma is cherries and sourness, funk. Taste is great, initial cherry and gueze like sour smack in the face, then fades into lovely sour cream and chive that I seem to get from a lot of their beers. Further sips focus more on the cherry, and even finds some room for some unusual sweetness. Cream cheese. Quite a wild beer. Great stuff. Really changes from sip to sip.
at my home with Yves dark red coloured body with a pink head and with a fruity sour malt hops aroma a fruity cherry sweet sour malt hop bitter taste with a sour bitter finish

33cl bottle. Hazy red with medium head. 
NOSE : dominating aromas of cherry with strong layer of yeast notes. Wet wood and lactic aromas. As well apple, rose and tart.
SIP : medium body with moderate carbonation. Creamy texture. It is more complex that what I have expected. Sweet tart with cherries beginning. Further on the dry and moderately sour nuances comes up. there is this very distinctive transition that happens in mouth while swallowing, the beer gets a nice sweet cherry kick with dry like apple seed bite. It also dont get to far with the sourness and manage to keep it round. And extra points for that. Aftertaste is cooked fruits and sour cherry like.
OVERALL : surprisingly complex and round. Easy to drink ....I mean really easy to drink since it is 8,5% and you only feel half of it. Nice one.

33 cl. bottle split by 3 @ Bar Oud Postje. Pours dark pomegranate with a disappearing pink head. Nose is sweet cherries, light tart nose, touch yoghurt & vinegar. Taste is yoghurt, light dairy mixed with tart berries & some sweet cherries, touch bitter mould pits & some caramel malts, lingering sourness, Way more sour than expected with a great fruit taste, very impressive stuff, Easy to drink & substantial body, nice stuff here.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2015 At molenhof 
Pours red 
Small , lightpink foam . Smell is very natural cherry , sweet good carbo , fleshy taste . Dry sugar 
Not that great .. 
3,6

Rerate
Bottle 75 cl . 
Pours pink/red . Smell is bit oak and cherries. Taste is Mildly sour, some oak. Cherries, bit of funk. bit fleshy. Very tastefull. 
More like a 3,9 now.

Bottle (thanks to hannont for sharing)... Poured cloudy reddish/ruby with a mild forming head. Nice cherry skin and wood characters on the nose. Good cherry notes with mild tartness and some drying musky funk in there too for complexity. Oak came in nicely too. A great drinking Kriek!

Bottle picked up in June 2013 from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, nr Gent, Belgie, consumed at Moreton in Marsh campsite, Friday 1st November 2013  Pours a beautiful, gorgeous, crystal clear scarlet red colour with a girlie pink head, looks stunning, absolutely superb. Sour nose, pushy sour cherries with a little damp paper. Clacky in mouth, sour cgerries, tart and then dry, there is a woody edge. There is a nod towards Rodenbach but only slight, this is out on its own. Love this, great beer, took a chance on this at Dranken Geers , had never seen before, will stock up next time.  A8 A5 T8 P4 Ov17 4.2
Beautiful bright and dark pink colour, very clear. Aroma is strongly of cherries. Has a good puckering sourness that is refreshing and very drinkable. Would be great on a hot summer day.

33cl bottle, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear red beer, nice stable reddish head.
NOSE: cherries, sour, wood.
TASTE: cherries, wood, brett, nice and sour!

Rouge rubis opaque, effervescence légère, belle mousse rose-rouge. Amère au départ avant que les cerises ne prennent le relais, libérant leur côté sucré-sûr et que le boisé fasse aussi son apparition. Le mélange triple-kriek est certes étonnant mais tellement innovant quon ne peut quapplaudir linitiative!

De Leites Cuvée Soeurise will wash that bad taste from my mouth! 750 yen or so, 8.5% an oak barrel aged triple Kriek from Uehata in Osaka. A beautiful blood red pour with a whitish-pink head of foam. Sour, tart cherry aroma with sweetness & some woodsy accents. Wow, interesting stuff, sweet & sour cherry followed by some boozy wood/oak notes giving it a rough earthy finish. I think this beer really comes off with a flavor profile similar to red wine. Good stuff & well worth trying. As it warms up some spices start to sneak through...

Bottle. Mild cherry aroma.Light, dull reddish color. Very light sour cherry initial / mild fruit continues in mid / finish has tannin-like tartness, which sticks to the back of the tongue. Light, dry, and refreshing. Interesting beer. The must have some good barrels to give it these special inflections. Thank you, Sister!
Bottled. Cherry and vanilla nose, cream, some vinegar. Deep red with a creamy, cyclamen head. Flavors of mild cherry, vanilla, not very sour. Wood, dry, woody finish. Nice body. Tasty.
Red with a small pink head. Strong cherry aroma with a touch of funk. Dry and tart flavour with sour cherries and a little leather and barnyard funk

Bottle sample @ VBPF 13.
Acajou, col fin beige.
Arôme de cerise avec ce côté fleuri frais et un houblon modéré.
Palais est de cerise, pointe daigreur fruitée qui ressort bien sans pour cela dominer. Le tout conserve un coté léger malt cara pils avec qcq houblons pour lamertume. Profile de retrait et fin de bouche reste centré sur une blonde belge avec ici un ajout fruité qui donne un côté râpeux. Alcool bien présent sans dominer avec un ajout boise qui donne une brève note boisée épicée qui sentremêle à la cerise. Une des meilleurs de DeLeite.

(draught) pours a murky deep ruby colour with a creamy pink head. aroma of cherries, lemons and orange peel, with a hint of vanilla, blackberries and bread dough. flavour is mostly the same, cherries, banana and herbal hops, with a hint of sugar icing and light alcohol in the finish. medium to heavy-bodied with very soft carbonation.

Tap @ ZBF 2013.
Pours completely red with a small, creamy, pink head. Aroma has cherries, marzipan, light red currant, good malty wheat. Medium to low carbonation, nice dry mouthfeel. Flavour is fairly bitter, cherries, tart, light marzipan. Pleasant zinging tart finish.

Taste this first time @ taste De Leite evening, Peerdeke Waregem on 09.03.2013.
Almost clear ruby red color, with good pink head. 
Aroma  cherry, woods, touch of alcohol. Medium Body.
Taste dry,little sour from woods, cherry, good refreshing., fruity ending.   Very good non-lambic kriek. 
GOOD BREW !

14/III/13 - 33cl bottle @ home (Gent) - BB: 13/XI/14 (2013-241) Thanks to Jerre for getting me the bottle!
Cloudy ruby red beer, big fizzy pink to red head, unstable, dissipates immediately, non adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, fresh cherries, cherry jam, some chloride, sourish, lemon, dairy, yoghurt, bit cheesy. MF: ok carbon, medium to light body. Taste: surprisingly bitter start, bit grassy, slightly fruity, sour cherries, but quickly overpowered by bitter metallic flavours. Aftertaste: some citric acidity, slightly fruity, bitter hops, metallic, cherries, some dairy, bitter yeast.
UPDATED: SEP 4, 2014 33cl, at 8.5%Vol, new exclusive brew Anno 2013, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex Kriek, fruity/woody and slightly sour/spicy, balanced, cloudy, small head, very good brew

Very good pink head, leaving lace over clear ruby beer. Smoked cherry nose. Not overpowering, but intriguing. Like old cherry skins on alcohol. Nice, dry, if not sour cherryflavour - but neither artificial. MF has a lipsmacking sourishness then, that is refreshing. Quite some (fruit?)slickness, grist; long fruity aftertaste. Very good non-lambic kriek. Misses maybe just a tad sourishness in order to appeal to greatness. Why not try, and recreate the Zottegemse Kriek from Crombé times...?
